about.description:
Almost everything in ROOT should be supported in this Conda package; ROOT was built with lots of options turned
on. Here are a few things to try:

* `root`: you can start up a session and see the splash screen; Control-D to exit.
* `python` followed by `import ROOT` will load PyROOT.
* `root --notebook` will start a notebook server with a ROOT kernel choice.
* `rootbrowse` will open a TBrowser session so you can look through files.
* `root -l -q $ROOTSYS/tutorials/dataframe/df013_InspectAnalysis.C` will run a DataFrame example with an animated plot.
* `root -b -q -l -n -e "std::cout << TROOT::GetTutorialDir() << std::endl;"` will print the tutorial dir.
* `root -b -l -q -e 'std::cout << (float) TPython::Eval("1+1") << endl;'` will run Python from C++ ROOT.

See the post [here](https://iscinumpy.gitlab.io/post/root-conda/) for more information about using this Conda package.

The ROOT package will prepare the required compilers. Everything in Conda is symlinked into
`$CONDA_PREFIX` if you build things by hand; tools like CMake should find it automatically. The `thisroot.*`
scripts should not be used and are not provided. Graphics, `rootbrowse`, etc. all should work. OpenGL is enabled.

There is also a `root_base` package, with minimal dependecies, that libraries should depend on this to avoid
having a runtime dependency on the `compilers` package. `root-dependencies` and `root-binaries` are also available. In most cases users should use the `root` package directly, since it adds both of these, along with compilers, Jupyter, and a few other things to facilitate using ROOT or PyROOT.

ROOT was built with and will report `-std=c++17` from `root-config`.
about.summary:
ROOT is a modular scientific software toolkit. It provides all the functionalities needed to deal with big data
processing, statistical analysis, visualisation and storage. It is mainly written in C++ but integrated with other
languages such as Python and R.

name: root-binaries
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.4
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: root-binaries
  version: 6.22.8
source:
  folder: root-source
  patches:
    - patches/0001-Patch-for-apple-silicon.patch
    - patches/7852.patch
    - patches/root-x.xx.xx-copy-abspath-headers.patch
    - patches/root-x.xx.xx-osx-remove-hardcoded-sysroot.patch
    - patches/root-x.xx.xx_cling-runtime-sysroot.patch
  sha256: cacb216cf9839662fd5b24ff6bd6e3c92e912bc36f0bcf42e9f0d38df52c9fea
  url: https://github.com/root-project/root/archive/v6-22-08.tar.gz
build:
  number: 3
  script:
    - set -euxo pipefail
    - mkdir -p ${PREFIX}/bin
    - ls ${PREFIX}/bin/
    - cp -rp ${SRC_DIR}/root-binaries/* ${PREFIX}/bin/
    - ls ${PREFIX}/bin/
  string: py38h595776f_3
requirements:

    - libpng 1.6.37 hf7e6567_2
    - librsvg 2.50.4 h957afdb_0
    - libssh2 1.9.0 hb80f160_6
    - libtiff 4.2.0 h70663a0_0
    - libwebp-base 1.2.0 h27ca646_2
    - libxml2 2.9.10 h538f51a_4
    - llvm-openmp 11.1.0 hf3c4609_1
    - lz4-c 1.9.3 h9f76cd9_0
    - ncurses 6.2 h9aa5885_4
    - numpy 1.19.5 py38h9e6c65a_1
    - openssl 1.1.1k h27ca646_0
    - pango 1.48.4 h1fe82c0_0
    - pcre 8.44 hb904e53_0
    - pip 21.0.1 pyhd8ed1ab_0
    - pixman 0.40.0 h27ca646_0
    - pythia8 8.304 py38h6f2b01f_0
    - python 3.8.8 h12cc5a1_0_cpython
    - python_abi 3.8 1_cp38
    - readline 8.1 hfbdcbf2_0
    - root_base 6.22.8 py38h9d209ef_3
    - setuptools 49.6.0 py38h10201cd_3
    - sqlite 3.35.4 hc49ca36_0
    - tbb 2021.2.0 hc021e02_0
    - tbb-devel 2021.2.0 hc021e02_0
    - tk 8.6.10 hf7e6567_1
    - vdt 0.4.3 h9f76cd9_0

    - xrootd 5.1.1 py38hf0cddae_0
    - xxhash 0.8.0 h27ca646_3
    - xz 5.2.5 h642e427_1
    - zlib 1.2.11 h31e879b_1009
    - zstd 1.4.9 h5b28eab_0
  run:
    - afterimage >=1.21,<1.22.0a0
    - cffi
    - cfitsio >=3.470,<3.471.0a0
    - davix >=0.7.6,<0.8.0a0
    - fftw >=3.3.9,<4.0a0
    - freetype >=2.10.4,<3.0a0
    - ftgl >=2.4.0,<2.4.1.0a0
    - gdk-pixbuf >=2.42.6,<3.0a0
    - giflib >=5.2.1,<5.3.0a0
    - gl2ps >=1.4.2,<1.4.3.0a0
    - glew >=2.1.0,<2.2.0a0
    - gsl >=2.6,<2.7.0a0
    - libblas >=3.9.0,<4.0a0
    - libcblas >=3.9.0,<4.0a0
    - libcxx >=11.1.0
    - libpng >=1.6.37,<1.7.0a0
    - librsvg >=2.50.4,<3.0a0
    - libtiff >=4.2.0,<5.0a0
    - libxml2 >=2.9.10,<2.10.0a0
    - lz4-c >=1.9.3,<1.9.4.0a0
    - numpy >=1.19.5,<2.0a0
    - openssl >=1.1.1k,<1.1.2a
    - pcre >=8.44,<9.0a0
    - pythia8 >=8.304,<8.400.0a0
    - python >=3.8,<3.9.0a0
    - python_abi 3.8.* *_cp38
    - root_base 6.22.8 py38h9d209ef_3
    - sqlite >=3.35.4,<4.0a0
    - tbb >=2021.2.0
    - vdt >=0.4.3,<0.4.4.0a0
    - xrootd >=5.1.1,<6.0a0
    - xxhash >=0.8.0,<0.8.1.0a0
    - xz >=5.2.5,<5.3.0a0
    - zlib >=1.2.11,<1.3.0a0
    - zstd >=1.4.9,<1.5.0a0
  run_constrained:
    - __osx >=11.0
test:
  commands:
    - root -l -b -q -x
    - root -l -b -q -x test.cpp
    - root -b -l -q -x -e '2+3; 0'
    - root -b -l -q -x -e 'gSystem->LoadAllLibraries(); 0'
    - echo ${CONDA_BUILD_SYSROOT}
    - thisroot.sh
    - thisroot.csh
    - thisroot.fish
    - root -b -l -q -x -e 'gStyle->SetCanvasPreferGL(kTRUE); c = new TCanvas(); if
      (!c->UseGL()) { throw std::runtime_error("OpenGL does not appear to be working");
      }'
    - root -b -l -q -x "${ROOTSYS}/tutorials/eve/geom_lhcb.C" || true
    - root -b -l -q -x "${ROOTSYS}/tutorials/tree/run_h1analysis.C"
    - XrdSecPROTOCOL=unix python -c "import ROOT; ROOT.ROOT.EnableImplicitMT(); rdf
      = ROOT.RDataFrame('DecayTree', 'root://eospublic.cern.ch//eos/opendata/lhcb/AntimatterMatters2017/data/B2HHH_MagnetUp.root');
      print(rdf.Cache('H1_PX').AsNumpy())"
  files:
    - test.cpp
    - test_pyroot.py
  requires:
    - root-dependencies 6.22.8 *_3
about:
  description: 'Almost everything in ROOT should be supported in this Conda package;
    ROOT was built with lots of options turned

    on. Here are a few things to try:


    * `root`: you can start up a session and see the splash screen; Control-D to exit.

    * `python` followed by `import ROOT` will load PyROOT.

    * `root --notebook` will start a notebook server with a ROOT kernel choice.

    * `rootbrowse` will open a TBrowser session so you can look through files.

    * `root -l -q $ROOTSYS/tutorials/dataframe/df013_InspectAnalysis.C` will run a
    DataFrame example with an animated plot.

    * `root -b -q -l -n -e "std::cout << TROOT::GetTutorialDir() << std::endl;"` will
    print the tutorial dir.

    * `root -b -l -q -e ''std::cout << (float) TPython::Eval("1+1") << endl;''` will
    run Python from C++ ROOT.


    See the post [here](https://iscinumpy.gitlab.io/post/root-conda/) for more information
    about using this Conda package.


    The ROOT package will prepare the required compilers. Everything in Conda is symlinked
    into

    `$CONDA_PREFIX` if you build things by hand; tools like CMake should find it automatically.
    The `thisroot.*`

    scripts should not be used and are not provided. Graphics, `rootbrowse`, etc.
    all should work. OpenGL is enabled.


    There is also a `root_base` package, with minimal dependecies, that libraries
    should depend on this to avoid

    having a runtime dependency on the `compilers` package. `root-dependencies` and
    `root-binaries` are also available. In most cases users should use the `root`
    package directly, since it adds both of these, along with compilers, Jupyter,
    and a few other things to facilitate using ROOT or PyROOT.


    ROOT was built with and will report `-std=c++17` from `root-config`.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/root-project/root/
  doc_url: https://root.cern/documentation
  home: https://root.cern/
  license: LGPL-2.1-only
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file: root-source/LICENSE
  summary: 'ROOT is a modular scientific software toolkit. It provides all the functionalities
    needed to deal with big data

    processing, statistical analysis, visualisation and storage. It is mainly written
    in C++ but integrated with other

    languages such as Python and R.

    '
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - chrisburr
    - egpbos
    - eguiraud
    - henryiii

about.description:
Almost everything in ROOT should be supported in this Conda package; ROOT was built with lots of options turned
on. Here are a few things to try:

* `root`: you can start up a session and see the splash screen; Control-D to exit.
* `python` followed by `import ROOT` will load PyROOT.
* `root --notebook` will start a notebook server with a ROOT kernel choice.
* `rootbrowse` will open a TBrowser session so you can look through files.
* `root -l -q $ROOTSYS/tutorials/dataframe/df013_InspectAnalysis.C` will run a DataFrame example with an animated plot.
* `root -b -q -l -n -e "std::cout << TROOT::GetTutorialDir() << std::endl;"` will print the tutorial dir.
* `root -b -l -q -e 'std::cout << (float) TPython::Eval("1+1") << endl;'` will run Python from C++ ROOT.

See the post [here](https://iscinumpy.gitlab.io/post/root-conda/) for more information about using this Conda package.

The ROOT package will prepare the required compilers. Everything in Conda is symlinked into
`$CONDA_PREFIX` if you build things by hand; tools like CMake should find it automatically. The `thisroot.*`
scripts should not be used and are not provided. Graphics, `rootbrowse`, etc. all should work. OpenGL is enabled.

There is also a `root_base` package, with minimal dependecies, that libraries should depend on this to avoid
having a runtime dependency on the `compilers` package. `root-dependencies` and `root-binaries` are also available. In most cases users should use the `root` package directly, since it adds both of these, along with compilers, Jupyter, and a few other things to facilitate using ROOT or PyROOT.

ROOT was built with and will report `-std=c++17` from `root-config`.
about.summary:
ROOT is a modular scientific software toolkit. It provides all the functionalities needed to deal with big data
processing, statistical analysis, visualisation and storage. It is mainly written in C++ but integrated with other
languages such as Python and R.

commands: root -b -l -q -x -e 'gStyle->SetCanvasPreferGL(kTRUE); c = new TCanvas(); if (!c->UseGL()) { throw std::runtime_error("OpenGL does not appear to be working"); }'

XrdSecPROTOCOL=unix python -c "import ROOT; ROOT.ROOT.EnableImplicitMT(); rdf = ROOT.RDataFrame('DecayTree', 'root://eospublic.cern.ch//eos/opendata/lhcb/AntimatterMatters2017/data/B2HHH_MagnetUp.root'); print(rdf.Cache('H1_PX').AsNumpy())"
